column4: Hey, can anyone tell me which graphics cards (any) work on the HP Pavillion dv9700?
when in doubt - stick with nvidia cards.
The graphics card is shot.. vesa works, but the resolution is 800x600 (too small) Maybe there was something I could do
shouldent be. if you set up a 'persistant' save location/file.  the permissions should stay correct
unless you want to start the Installer. :)
you may want to setup a live flash drive  some how - boot using that. and fsck/recover any data. that HD may be badly broken
coz_: Isn't there something in initramfs? And my hard disk is okay actually cuz I'm using it right now while IRC'ing... It's a sturdy netbook just maybe the power went out which caused the hd errors
head crashing into platters - bad karma :)  You can fsck it if you want.. but its possible it may have future issues
i always keep a flash drive  with a rescue/restore/repair disrto on it. for such cases
the ubuntu-rescue (recovery?) variant i recall is CLI only
theres a ubuntui recovery variant. and otehr rescue live cd/usb vasriants. depending on you rneeds
check  disrtowatch.com - they mention most of the variants,
Do you know of a simple good liveCD version of a distro that's under 150 MB's? Ubuntu-rescue-remix is 177 MBs
tiny core linux = 11 mb. install what you want.
I dont see a reason for the 150mb limit. :) so ive never paied attention tio the sises
alright lol well im in a bit of a hurry
